thread.title: Kieran Read's mystery replacement: Crusaders No 8 Whetu Douglas answers the call
thread.title_full: Kieran Read's mystery replacement: Crusaders No 8 Whetu Douglas answers the call

author: Richard Knowler
title: Kieran Read's mystery replacement: Crusaders No 8 Whetu Douglas answers the call
text:
* Car sponsor dumps Dan Carter over drink-driving charge 
Last year the closest Douglas, who captained Waikato in the Mitre 10 Cup and was also invited on the New Zealand Maori tour of the northern hemisphere, got to a Super Rugby team was when the Chiefs invited him to join training for a few weeks as injury cover. GETTY 
Waikato co-captains Whetu Douglas and Brad Weber with the Ranfurly Shield. 
New Crusaders coach Scott Robertson clearly thought Douglas, 25, went alright for the province he had represented since 2013. 
Robertson sent out a message that he was keeping an eye on him, and when it was confirmed that Read required an operation on his wrist during the offseason and wouldn't return to the Crusaders until mid-April, Douglas got invited to Christchurch for pre-season training and was told to fight for a job. 
You won't find Douglas's name in the official squad, but that is irrelevant. Given how the Crusaders pack operated against the Brumbies, and he noted that packing down behind so many All Blacks was a magic carpet ride, he should get a run against the Highlanders, in Dunedin this weekend. PHOTOSPORT 
Whetu Douglas celebrates scoring for the Crusaders during their 17-13 win over the Brumbies at AMI Stadium last Saturday night. Seta Tamanivalu also seems happy with the result. 
Not surprisingly, given that the Brumbies fielded a number of internationals and veteran full-time professionals, Douglas said the pace and physicality of his first Super Rugby game was a standard above the Mitre 10 Cup. Ad Feedback 
One of the toughest areas to negotiate, he added, was the lineout. 
"At lineout time the movements on the ground and getting in the air is a split-second quicker, so you have to trust your instincts and what you have practised during the week," Douglas said. 
If Douglas hadn't been asked by Robertson to join the Crusaders he was unsure which team he would be aligned with. 
"I hadn't heard anything otherwise, to be honest the first interest was from Razor (Robertson). I would be definitely battling away with the University club in Hamilton." - Stuff
